  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public static Board getBoard()
      The getBoard function is a static function that returns the current board. If there is no board, it creates one and then returns it.
      Returns:
      The current board

    • getBoardModel

      public static Board getBoardModel()
      The getBoardModel function returns the Board object that is used to store all of the information about the current state of a game. This function is called by other classes in order to access this information.
      Returns:
      The boardmodelhelper

    • getTiles

      public Tile[][] getTiles()
      The getTiles function returns a copy of the board.
      Returns:
      A copy of the board array

    • checkBoundaries

      public boolean checkBoundaries(Word w)
      The checkBoundaries function checks to see if the word is within the boundaries of the board.
      Parameters:
      w - w Access the length of the word, and whether it is vertical or horizontal
      Returns:
      A boolean value

    • checkNeighbors

      public boolean checkNeighbors(Word w)
      The checkNeighbors function checks to see if the word being placed has any neighbors.
      Parameters:
      w - w Pass in the word that is being placed on the board
      Returns:
      True if the word has a neighbor

    • boardLegal

      public boolean boardLegal(Word w)
      The boardLegal function checks if the word is legal to be placed on the board. It first checks if the word is within boundaries of the board, then it checks if there are any neighboring words that are connected to this new word. If all these conditions pass, then we know that this new word can be placed on our gameboard.
      Parameters:
      w - w Pass the word that is being checked for legality
      Returns:
      False if the word is not on the board

    • dictionaryLegal

      public boolean dictionaryLegal(Word w)
      The dictionaryLegal function checks whether a word is legal according to the dictionary.
      Parameters:
      w - w Pass the word that is being checked for legality
      Returns:
      True if the word is in the dictionary, and false otherwise

    • getWords

      public ArrayList<Word> getWords(Word w)
      The getWords function takes in a Word object and returns an ArrayList of all the words that are formed by placing the tiles from the input word onto the board. The function first checks if it is a vertical or horizontal word, then iterates through each tile in w.tiles to find any new words that are formed when placing this tile on top of another letter already on the board. If there is no letter below/to-the-right of this tile, then we know there will be no new word created here so we skip over it. Otherwise, we add every Tile to our temp ArrayList until either
      Parameters:
      w - the direction of the word
      Returns:
      An arraylist of word objects

    • getWordsForChallenge

      public ArrayList<Word> getWordsForChallenge(Word w)
      The getWordsForChallenge function takes in a Word object and returns an ArrayList of all the words that are formed by the tiles on the board. The function first checks if it is a vertical word, then iterates through each tile in w.tiles and adds all new words to an ArrayList called "words". If it is not a vertical word, then we do the same thing but for horizontal words instead. We also add w itself to this list because we want to challenge every single word that was played on this turn.
      Parameters:
      w - w Determine the row and column of the word
      Returns:
      An arraylist of all the words that are formed by placing a word on the board

    • getScore

      public int getScore(Word w)
      The getScore function takes in a Word object and returns the score of that word. The function first checks if the word is legal by checking if it is in the dictionary. If it isn't, then 0 is returned because no points are awarded for an illegal word. Otherwise, we check to see if there are any other words formed when placing this new word on the board. If there aren't any other words formed (i.e., this was our first turn), then we just calculate and return the score of this one new word placed on our board without worrying about bonuses or anything else since
      Returns:
      The score of the word w if it is placed on the board

    • tryPlaceWord

      public int tryPlaceWord(Word word)
      The tryPlaceWord function takes a Word object as an argument and returns the score of that word. It first checks if the board is empty, in which case it sets firstTurn to true. Then it calls boardLegal to check if the word can be placed on the board, and then gets its score by calling getScore. If all these conditions are met, then tryPlaceWord places each tile from that word onto its corresponding spot on the gameboard (by setting each element of 2D array "board" equal to a Tile object). Finally, tryPlaceWord returns either 0 or this score
      Parameters:
      word - Get the row and column of the word
      Returns:
      The score of the word if it is legal, and 0 otherwise

    • parseBoardToString

      public String parseBoardToString(Tile[][] board)
      The parseBoardToString function takes a 2D array of Tiles and returns a String representation of the board. The string is formatted as follows: - Each row is separated by a newline character '\n' - If the tile at position (i, j) exists, then its letter should be printed in place of the '.' character. Otherwise, print out '.'.
      Parameters:
      board - Represent the board
      Returns:
      A string representation of the board

    • parseBoardToCharacterArray

      public Character[][] parseBoardToCharacterArray(Tile[][] board)
      The parseBoardToCharacterArray function takes in a 2D array of Tile objects and returns a 2D array of Characters. The function iterates through the board, and for each tile it finds, it adds the letter to the characterBoard. If there is no tile at that position on the board, then null is added to that position in characterBoard instead.
      Parameters:
      board - Represent the board that is passed in
      Returns:
      A 2d array of characters

    • parseCharacterArrayToString

      public String parseCharacterArrayToString(Character[][] board)
      The parseCharacterArrayToString function takes a 2D array of characters and returns a string representation of the board. The function is used to print out the current state of the game board.
      Parameters:
      board - Represent the board
      Returns:
      A string representation of the board

    • placeTile

      public void placeTile(Tile selectedTile, int row, int column)
      The placeTile function places a tile on the board.
      Parameters:
      selectedTile - Place the tile on the board
      row - Determine the row that the tile will be placed in
      column - Represent the column of the board that is being placed

    • removeTile

      public void removeTile(int row, int column)
      The removeTile function removes a tile from the board.
      Parameters:
      row - Determine which row the tile is in
      column - Specify the column of the tile to be removed
